description: From high +â€Ž tail; refers to the behavior of fleeing animals, such as deer, that raise their tail when running away.

verbs.description: hightail (third-person singular simple present hightails, present participle hightailing, simple past and past participle hightailed)

entries.meaning: (informal, chiefly Canada, US, usually transitive) To move at full speed, especially in retreat.
examples: Synonyms: skedaddle; see also Thesaurus:move quickly
I want you to hightail your butt out of there before they come back.
